QRCode implementation

This module implements an object to hold the initial data of a QRCode, being the string wanted to be used to create a QRCode with. This string is also used to know which size the QR code will need to be to hold that data and in which mode it will be encoded.

The main procedures consist of the functions mentioned earlier, setMostEfficientMode to set the best mode to encode the data and setSmallestVersion to set the smallest QR code size where the data can fit.

Imports

qrCapacities, qrCharacters, qrTypes

Types

DataSizeDefect = object of Defect
Defect emitted by setSmallestVersion when data can't fit in any QR code version with the specified mode and ecLevel or by checkSize when data can't fit in the specified version, mode and ecLevel.   Source   Edit 
QRCode = object
  mode*: QRMode
  version*: QRVersion
  ecLevel*: QRECLevel
  data*: string
An object holding the data string to encode, data, the mode in which it will be encoded, mode, the size the QR code will need to hold the data, version, and the error correction level used to generate the generate the error correction codewords, ecLevel.   Source   Edit

Procs

proc newQRCode(data: string; ecLevel: QRECLevel = qrECL): QRCode {....raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Creates a new QRCode object with the specified data and ecLevel.
Note: ecLevel will be qrECL by default.
Note: setMostEfficientMode will be used.
Note: setSmallestVersion will be used.

Note: ecLevel will be qrECL by default.

    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates a new QRCode object with the specified data, version and ecLevel.
Note: ecLevel will be qrECL by default.
Note: setMostEfficientMode will be used.
Note: checkSize will be used.
  Source   Edit 
proc setMostEfficientMode(self: var QRCode) {....raises: [], tags: [].}

Set's self.mode to the most efficient mode by checking all of it's characters.

If all it's characters are numbers (0..9), then the mode will be qrNumericMode.

If all its characters are in the alphaNumericValues set, then the mode will be qrAlphanumericMode.

Else the mode will be qrByteMode.

  Source   Edit 
proc setSmallestVersion(self: var QRCode) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Set's self.version to the smallest version where self.data can fit.
Note: If self.data can't fit in any of the versions with specified mode, version and ecLevel, a DataSizeDefect will be raised.
  Source   Edit

template `[]`[T](self: QRCapacity[T]; qr: QRCode): T
A helper template to get the value stored in self from the ecLevel and version of qr.   Source   Edit 
template checkSize(self: QRCode)
Helper template to check if self.data fits in the specified version.
Note: If self.data can't fit in any of the versions with specified mode, version and ecLevel, a DataSizeDefect will be raised.
Note: When setSmallestVersion is used, there is no to use this.
  Source   Edit
